result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dion Ray Couveau

defendant.name: Couveau, Dion Ray
defendant.address: 8828 West Maple Street #5, West Allis, WI 53214

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Dion Ray Couveau in court with attorney Peter Kovac.  Defendant Dion Ray Couveau in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.
For reasons stated on the record court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 4.

Attorney Peter J. Kovac in court, defendant Dion Ray Couveau not in court, in custody at the House of Corrections and not produced.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail motion by defense argued and DENIED by the Court. Court ordered bail conditions to remain the same.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Dion Ray Couveau in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Defendant Dion Ray Couveau in custody.  
Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: sm  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 04.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defense request speedy plea date.
Bail/bond hearing/ Status hearing scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Peter J. Kovac in court.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for 10-20-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dion Ray Couveau not in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, court ordered arrest warrant issued but STAYED issuance until 10/20/15.vb
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 9/18/15 @ 1:30pm
